title: What things did your country have before that don’t exist anymore? - Quora

response.answer_text: Speaking about Lithuania. Returning back more, than 100 years our language was a bit different, it was richer by verb and proverb forms. I am not specialist, so I can’t tell in details. With total melioration ( destroying swamps ) and agriculture development we lost many species. I was collecting bugs and butterflies being a child and I can tell for sure, that more than two hundred species of insects are gone. Lithuania had world top level biotechnologies three decades ago. Our brand new head facility of biotechnology is demolished and all the branch destroyed during recent independency period. There is powerfull ( 8GW ) nuclear plant, still fully operating, but producing no electric power anymore. Looks like this plan is lost forever. Lithuania produced modern semiconductor devices. The high speed varicaps and varistors were highly demanded by space technologies, as well as thick layer hybride chips. Lithuania had hudge industry of cotton. This is strategically stupid and don’t exist anymore. We produced our own sugar in five big sugar plants. We produced chokolate. The brand and trade mark is still alive, but no production anymore. Lithuania had powerfull machinetool building industry ( some machinetools were demanded in Japan ). Gone, together with stell processing plants. There was a big and famous plant of wooden panell houses production. Gone forewer. Big and unique glass plant. Lithuania had civil fleet for trade and highly develloped fishing industry. Gone, together with shipyards. There were more than 40 airports in Lithuania. Five are operating now, including the secret military ones. By the way, there were many military facilities: missile launcher sites, tank production and repair plant, submarine port and so on. Gone with collapse of SU. The radio interference facilities. Unique secret radio stations, making radio noise and sinking tremendous electrical power. Gone. The spying equimpent in restaurants, hotels - not anymore. The relay style phone communication system. The plant of safety matches. The name still exists, no production anymore.
Radioactive science kits.  We can attribute the decline to health concerns and the lingering fear of atomic bombs over our heads.

My England lost its independence on October 14, 1066 and that independence, cultural, linguistic, political and economic ceased to exist for ever on that fateful day. Naturally! the Normans spent the eve of the battle on their knees praying for divine intervention. My countrymen, as is their wont, spent it having a good booze up and had to fight the daylong battle with a hangover.

Cheap real estate in California! Or affordable real estate near any city with highly educated people, public transportation, enlightened government, and great jobs. As a few cities become more and more educated than the rest of the country, it gets increasingly expensive to live here, and the alternative of moving to a place with uneducated people is dangerous and unpleasant.
A superb narrow gauge railway network; a fine Georgian urban architecture; clean sweet tap water; modest crime; a narcotics-free ethos. kids walking to school; etc.
Canada no longer has lucrative trading stations along every river whose sole purpose was to collect and trade beaver skins to use their fur to make stylish felt top hats for rich Europeans.

A2A Malaria Before the swamps that filled the land, due to centuries of drainage neglect, were drained, Malaria was a major killer.[1] Footnotes[1] How was malaria of 100 years ago eradicated in Palestine/Israel? And without vaccine?
